thread.title: Real Madrid chase Tottenham reject who was loaned out to League Two Cheltenham Town
thread.title_full: Real Madrid chase Tottenham reject who was loaned out to League Two Cheltenham Town

author: Darren Wells
title: Real Madrid chase Tottenham reject who was loaned out to League Two Cheltenham Town

organizations.name: league two cheltenham town sport real madrid

text:
Sport Real Madrid chase Tottenham reject who was loaned out to League Two Cheltenham Town Yuri Berchiche spent three years on Spurs books but didn't make a single appearance for the senior side Share Yuri Berchiche is a reported target for Real Madrid (Photo: Getty) Share Get Real Madrid CF updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Spanish giants Real Madrid have made a former Tottenham player a surprise transfer target, despite him never having played for the Spurs' first team. 
Fans of the White Hart Lane club could be forgiven for not remembering Yuri Berchiche, considering he didn't make a single appearance for the North London side. 
But he has done enough at current club Real Sociedad to show up on Real Madrid boss Zinedine Zidane's radar, and he could now be set for a summer switch, reports The Sun . Yuri Berchiche chases after the ball with fellow ex-Spurs man Gareth Bale (Photo: Getty) 
Berchiche joined Tottenham's academy from Athletic Bilbao back in 2007 but was released three years later to Spanish third division side Real Union. 
The pacey left-back did get some experience of English football though when he was loaned out to League Two Cheltenham Town, where he made his professional debut in the first of nine appearances at the club. 
Following a move to Sociedad in 2012 he was immediately loaned out to Eibar for two seasons, but did enough to force his way into the first XI on his return after some impressive displays. Berchiche competes for the ball with Luis Suarez (Photo: Getty) Read More Development of Tottenham's new stadium continues 
The 27-year-old has even been earmarked for a debut for the Spanish national team, having already been named as part of a preliminary squad before missing the final cut. 
Real Sociedad have been performing well in La Liga this season, currently sitting in sixth place and just seven points off the Champions League spots. 
Berchiche has been ever present for the Basque club, starting 25 times this season and even weighing in with two goals. poll loading
